description: A road map represents a high-level plan for a project or team.

title.description: A brief title which describes this road map.

description.description: A markdown formatted description of what this road map represents and any additional context which may be useful to a reader.

timeline.description: The list of important dates which relate to this road map.

objectives.description: The list of objectives which the team is working towards over the course of this road map.

milestones.description: The list of milestones which act as indicators of progress for this road map.

Author.description: The details of an author responsible for this road map, should a reader have questions.

name.description: The full name of the author.

contact.description: The contact address for the author - usually their email, but may also be an IM handle or otherwise.

TimelineMarker.description: An important date which relates to this road map.

date.description: The date that this timeline marker is associated with.

title.description: A brief name associated with this timeline marker to describe it.

description.description: A markdown formatted description of what this timeline marker represents, or additional context associated with it.

Objective.description: An objective describes a high level goal for the team. It is usually something that will be worked towards over several milestones and might not have a clear definition of done.

title.description: A brief name associated with this objective which describes the intended outcome.

description.description: A markdown formatted description of what this objective represents and how it influences the direction that the team is moving in.

examples.title: Our users love the documentation we provide
examples.description: Great documentation is critical to the adoption of our project and is an integral part of everything we introduce.

Milestone.description: An indicator of progress for this road map. Usually milestones are collections of deliverables which, when considered together, represent a shift in the value delivered by a team or project.

title.description: A brief name associated with this milestone to describe the value shift.

description.description: A markdown formatted description of what this milestone represents and, if appropriate, the justification for its presence and prioritization.

reference.description: A URI at which additional information about this milestone may be found (whether that be documentation or a tracking ticket).

deliverables.description: The list of deliverables which make up this milestone. Deliverables usually map to specific pieces of work which may be delegated to a member of your team.

examples.title: Documentation Website
examples.description: Publish a documentation website for the project, with information that customers can use to understand how to use it.

deliverables.title: Setup Docs Repo
deliverables.description: Create a documentation repository and configure the build tooling to generate and publish a website.

deliverables.title: Getting Started Guide
deliverables.description: Put together a getting started guide for new customers.

Deliverable.description: A specific piece of work which may be delegated to a member of the team.

title.description: A brief name describing this deliverable.

description.description: A markdown formatted description of what this deliverable entails and why it is necessary for this milestone.

reference.description: A URI at which additional information about this deliverable may be found (whether that be documentation or a tracking ticket).

State.description: The state of an item on the road map.

Requirement.description: An RFC2119 verb which describes how a specific requirement should be treated.
